pageContext.claim: “But we would have had millions of deaths instead of -- it looks like we'll be at about a 60,000 mark, which is 40,000 less than the lowest number thought of.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. would surpass 100,000 recorded deaths from covid-19 months weeks later. When Trump made these remarks on April 19, the U.S. had nearly 33,000 deaths and experts predicted the total would keep rising. So there was little to no scientific basis for Trump's prediction.
